notes.text:
Toast pine nuts for deeper flavor
Pesto can be made ahead and frozen
Add a splash of lemon juice for brightness

steps.descr: Cook pasta in salted boiling water

on_enter.say: Right, let's get started by cooking our pasta in a big pot of salted boiling water. It should be bubbling away nicely!

steps.instructions: Cook pasta in salted boiling water

steps.descr: Blend basil, pine nuts, garlic, and Parmesan

on_enter.say: Now, let's make our beautiful pesto. Pop the basil, pine nuts, garlic, and Parmesan into a blender. Give it a whizz until it's all combined.

steps.instructions: Blend basil, pine nuts, garlic, and Parmesan

steps.descr: Drizzle in olive oil while blending

on_enter.say: Lovely! Now, while the blender is running, slowly drizzle in the olive oil. You'll see it turn into a smooth, luscious sauce.

steps.instructions: Drizzle in olive oil while blending

steps.descr: Season pesto with salt and pepper

on_enter.say: Time to season our pesto. Add a pinch of salt and a good grind of pepper. Taste it to make sure it's just right.

steps.instructions: Season pesto with salt and pepper

on_enter.say: Let's reserve a cup of that starchy pasta water, then drain the pasta. This water will help us get the perfect sauce consistency.

steps.descr: Toss pasta with pesto, add pasta water to loosen

on_enter.say: Now, let's toss the pasta with our fresh pesto. Add a splash of the reserved pasta water to loosen it up. It should look glossy and delicious!

steps.instructions: Toss pasta with pesto, add pasta water to loosen

steps.descr: Serve with halved cherry tomatoes and extra Parmesan

on_enter.say: Time to plate up! Serve your pasta with some halved cherry tomatoes and a sprinkle of extra Parmesan. Enjoy your meal!

steps.instructions: Serve with halved cherry tomatoes and extra Parmesan

recipe.title: Pesto Pasta
recipe.description: Simple pasta with fresh basil pesto and Parmesan
